content.rendered:
Many of our local interfaith partners have moved their worship services, prayers, reflections and classes online during the coronavirus pandemic.  We are blessed with a local interfaith community that supports our spiritual well-being and who models and inspires compassion, love, harmony, and justice.  Their virtual offerings not only support our community’s spiritual well-being, they are also a unique opportunity for interfaith engagement.  Tune into their virtual world and be inspired!

Local Interfaith Community – Virtual Worship

Catholic

Holy Name of Mary Catholic Church, San Dimas
Our Lady of the Assumption, Claremont

Protestant Christian

La Verne Church of the Brethren (founders of ULV), La Verne
Claremont Presbyterian, Claremont
Good Shepherd Lutheran,, Claremont
St. Ambrose Episcopal Church, Claremont
Claremont Methodist, Claremont
Claremont United Church of Christ, Claremont
St. John’s Episcopal Church, La Verne

Non-Denominational Christian

Water of Life Community Church, Fontana
All Nations San Bernardino, San Bernardino

New Thought

Unity Church of Pomona, Pomona

Unitarian/Universalist

Palomar Unitarian/Universality Church, Vista

Jewish

Temple Beth Israel, Pomona

Muslim

Islamic Center of Claremont, Claremont

Buddhist

Tzu Chi Foundation, San Dimas
Middle Land Chan Monestary, Pomona

Greater So California and Beyond

Interfaith Online Worship Services in Southern CA

Baha’i

Baha’i Communities of Greater Los Angeles

Hindu

Vedanta Society of Southern CA
International Society for Krishna Consciousness

Sikh

Sikh Dharma International
